bibl.title: Letter from Howard A. Kelly to L.O. Howard, November 1, 1906

div1.p: Kelly requests to see Reed's account of the experiments, which had been mailed to Howard. A plaque for Walter Reed at King's County Hospital, in Brooklyn, will be dedicated.

div1.head: Letter from Howard A. Kelly to L.O. Howard, November 1, 1906
div1.opener:
FROM L. O. HOWARD
OR LUCY HOWARD
1418 Eutaw Place.
Dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
Thank you for your most interesting letter. I want some
day to see that Reed letter. What you write about the banquet is
most interesting too. Might I perhaps get a copy of the mosq.
letter & refer to your interest in the work & association with it at
a banquet at Brooklyn on the present. of a medallion to the King's
Co. Hosp. where he was for a time.

Excuse sundry minor mistakes in the bk. A second ed. will
be necessary soon.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, (Signed) HOWARD A. KELLY 1 Nov. '06.
